preqs: Students must successfully complete coursework units. However, students may, with the written agreement of the student adviser, undertake a thesis before completing all the coursework requirements.
description: This is a unit of research study focusing on a particular theory, issue, challenge, dilemma, concern or problem in the field of psychology, undertaken with a supervisor. While students are expected to demonstrate initiative and independence, the supervisor offers guidance, support and feedback over the course of the research. The thesis is especially important for students who are intending to undertake further higher degree studies. Graduates who have successfully completed the psychology thesis (both part 1 and part 2) are able to use this 12,000- to 16,000-word study as evidence of independent research experience in an application for entry into the PhD course.
